docs.title: About
docs.text: CP-Tricki is a collection of tricks for competitive programming inspired by Tricki.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
To contribute, you can: - Create a pull request from fork (can be fully done via GitHub's web interface)

or

  • Open an issue with proposed changes

docs.title: Article titles
docs.text:
When creating a new Markdown file, specify article title via 

---
title: Your title
---
Another option is to use # Your title, but we do not recommend it.

docs.title: Code
docs.text:
To insert code, use 

``` c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
```
Specifying programming language after backticks enables code highlighting.

docs.title: Text and subheadings
docs.text: To break text on the page into paragraphs, simply leave a blank line between two bodies of text. To insert subheadings, put ## HTML h2 heading, ### HTML h3 heading, #### HTML h4 heading etc. on separate line. Using # HTML h1 heading is not recommended.

docs.title: Math
docs.text: To add math, use \\( n^2 = -1 \\) inline. This will render as \( n^2 = -1 \). To put a formula in a separate block, use \\[\int e^x dx = e^x + c\\]. This will result in \[\int e^x dx = e^x + c\]
